p: In conclusion, the present study is the first to report the essential oil composition and bioactivities of W. glabra from Tibet, China. The essential oil of W. glabra showed anti-influenza and anti-inflammatory effects, but no anti-complementary activity. The essential oil and the non-volatile extract should play different roles on the medical use of W. glabra. However, the composition of the essential oil W. glabra from Gangs Rinpoche Mountain (Trans-Himalaya Mountain Range in Tibet) were quite different from the reported W. glabra sample from Nepal. Thus, further comparison of the bioactivities and active compounds of W. glabra samples from north, south, and trans-Himalaya regions will be of great importance.
